class.name: EditorSyntaxHighlighter
class.brief_description: Base class for [SyntaxHighlighter] used by the [ScriptEditor].
class.description: Base class that all [SyntaxHighlighter]s used by the [ScriptEditor] extend from. Add a syntax highlighter to an individual script by calling [method ScriptEditorBase.add_syntax_highlighter]. To apply to all scripts on open, call [method ScriptEditor.register_syntax_highlighter].

method.name: _create
method.description: Virtual method which creates a new instance of the syntax highlighter.

method.name: _get_name
method.description: Virtual method which can be overridden to return the name that is displayed in the editor when selecting between syntax highlighters. For example: [code]"Markdown"[/code].

method.name: _get_supported_languages
method.description: Virtual method which can be overridden to return the supported file extensions. This method should return a list of file extensions without the leading period. For example: [code]PackedStringArray(["md", "markdown"])[/code]. Files that do not have any supported syntax highlighter will be displayed without any highlighting. [b]Note:[/b] The user can manually override the syntax highlighting used for any open file, via the [b]Edit > Syntax Highlighter[/b] option at the top of the Script Editor.
